speaker: FRANCIS
text: What the devil hast thou brought there—

speaker: FRANCIS
text: applejohns? Thou knowest Sir John cannot endure

speaker: FRANCIS
text: an applejohn.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              DRAWER
text: Mass, thou sayst true. The Prince

speaker:
SECOND
               
              DRAWER
text: once set a dish of applejohns before him and told

speaker:
SECOND
               
              DRAWER
text: him there were five more Sir Johns and, putting off

speaker:
SECOND
               
              DRAWER
text: his hat, said “I will now take my leave of these six

speaker:
SECOND
               
              DRAWER
text: dry, round, old, withered knights.” It angered him

speaker:
SECOND
               
              DRAWER
text: to the heart. But he hath forgot that.

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Why then, cover and set them down, and see if

speaker: FRANCIS
text: thou canst find out Sneak’s noise. Mistress Tearsheet

speaker: FRANCIS
text: would fain hear some music. Dispatch. The

speaker: FRANCIS
text: room where they supped is too hot. They’ll come in

speaker: FRANCIS
text: straight.

speaker: WILL
text: Sirrah, here will be the Prince and Master

speaker: WILL
text: Poins anon, and they will put on two of our jerkins

speaker: WILL
text: and aprons, and Sir John must not know of it.

speaker: WILL
text: Bardolph hath brought word.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              DRAWER
text: By the Mass, here will be old utis. It

speaker:
SECOND
               
              DRAWER
text: will be an excellent stratagem.

speaker: FRANCIS
text: I’ll see if I can find out Sneak.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: I’ faith, sweetheart, methinks now you are in

speaker: HOSTESS
text: an excellent good temperality. Your pulsidge beats

speaker: HOSTESS
text: as extraordinarily as heart would desire, and your

speaker: HOSTESS
text: color, I warrant you, is as red as any rose, in good

speaker: HOSTESS
text: truth, la. But, i’ faith, you have drunk too much

speaker: HOSTESS
text: canaries, and that’s a marvellous searching wine,

speaker: HOSTESS
text: and it perfumes the blood ere one can say “What’s

speaker: HOSTESS
text: this?” How do you now?

speaker: DOLL
text: Better than I was. Hem.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Why, that’s well said. A good heart’s worth

speaker: HOSTESS
text: gold. Lo, here comes Sir John.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: When Arthur first in court—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
To
                 
                Will
                .
                 
              Empty the jordan.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: And was a worthy king—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: How now, Mistress Doll?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Sick of a calm, yea, good faith.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: So is all her sect. An they be once in a calm,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: they are sick.

speaker: DOLL
text: A pox damn you, you muddy rascal. Is that all the

speaker: DOLL
text: comfort you give me?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You make fat rascals, Mistress Doll.

speaker: DOLL
text: I make them? Gluttony and diseases make them;

speaker: DOLL
text: I make them not.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: If the cook help to make the gluttony, you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: help to make the diseases, Doll. We catch of you,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Doll, we catch of you. Grant that, my poor virtue,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: grant that.

speaker: DOLL
text: Yea, joy, our chains and our jewels.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Your brooches, pearls, and ouches—for to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: serve bravely is to come halting off, you know; to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: come off the breach with his pike bent bravely, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: to surgery bravely, to venture upon the charged

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: chambers bravely—

speaker: DOLL
text: Hang yourself, you muddy conger, hang yourself!

speaker: HOSTESS
text: By my troth, this is the old fashion. You two

speaker: HOSTESS
text: never meet but you fall to some discord. You are

speaker: HOSTESS
text: both, i’ good truth, as rheumatic as two dry toasts.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: You cannot one bear with another’s confirmities.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: What the good-year! One must bear, and

speaker: HOSTESS
text: that must be you. You are the weaker vessel, as they

speaker: HOSTESS
text: say, the emptier vessel.

speaker: DOLL
text: Can a weak empty vessel bear such a huge full

speaker: DOLL
text: hogshead? There’s a whole merchant’s venture of

speaker: DOLL
text: Bordeaux stuff in him. You have not seen a hulk

speaker: DOLL
text: better stuffed in the hold.—Come, I’ll be friends

speaker: DOLL
text: with thee, Jack. Thou art going to the wars, and

speaker: DOLL
text: whether I shall ever see thee again or no, there is

speaker: DOLL
text: nobody cares.

speaker: DRAWER
text: Sir, Ancient Pistol’s below and would speak

speaker: DRAWER
text: with you.

speaker: DOLL
text: Hang him, swaggering rascal! Let him not come

speaker: DOLL
text: hither. It is the foul-mouthed’st rogue in England.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: If he swagger, let him not come here. No, by

speaker: HOSTESS
text: my faith, I must live among my neighbors. I’ll no

speaker: HOSTESS
text: swaggerers. I am in good name and fame with the

speaker: HOSTESS
text: very best. Shut the door. There comes no swaggerers

speaker: HOSTESS
text: here. I have not lived all this while to have

speaker: HOSTESS
text: swaggering now. Shut the door, I pray you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Dost thou hear, hostess?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Pray you pacify yourself, Sir John. There

speaker: HOSTESS
text: comes no swaggerers here.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Dost thou hear? It is mine ancient.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Tilly-vally, Sir John, ne’er tell me. And your

speaker: HOSTESS
text: ancient swaggerer comes not in my doors. I was

speaker: HOSTESS
text: before Master Tisick the debuty t’ other day, and, as

speaker: HOSTESS
text: he said to me—’twas no longer ago than Wednesday

speaker: HOSTESS
text: last, i’ good faith—“Neighbor Quickly,” says

speaker: HOSTESS
text: he—Master Dumb, our minister, was by then—

speaker: HOSTESS
text: “Neighbor Quickly,” says he, “receive those that

speaker: HOSTESS
text: are civil, for,” said he, “you are in an ill name.”

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Now he said so, I can tell whereupon. “For,” says

speaker: HOSTESS
text: he, “you are an honest woman, and well thought

speaker: HOSTESS
text: on. Therefore take heed what guests you receive.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Receive,” says he, “no swaggering companions.”

speaker: HOSTESS
text: There comes none here. You would bless you to

speaker: HOSTESS
text: hear what he said. No, I’ll no swaggerers.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: He’s no swaggerer, hostess, a tame cheater, i’

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: faith. You may stroke him as gently as a puppy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: greyhound. He’ll not swagger with a Barbary hen if

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: her feathers turn back in any show of resistance.—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Call him up, drawer.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: “Cheater” call you him? I will bar no honest

speaker: HOSTESS
text: man my house, nor no cheater, but I do not love

speaker: HOSTESS
text: swaggering. By my troth, I am the worse when one

speaker: HOSTESS
text: says “swagger.” Feel, masters, how I shake; look

speaker: HOSTESS
text: you, I warrant you.

speaker: DOLL
text: So you do, hostess.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Do I? Yea, in very truth, do I, an ’twere an

speaker: HOSTESS
text: aspen leaf. I cannot abide swaggerers.

speaker: PISTOL
text: God save you, Sir John.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Welcome, Ancient Pistol. Here, Pistol, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: charge you with a cup of sack. Do you discharge

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: upon mine hostess.

speaker: PISTOL
text: I will discharge upon her, Sir John, with two

speaker: PISTOL
text: bullets.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: She is pistol-proof. Sir, you shall not hardly

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: offend her.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Come, I’ll drink no proofs nor no bullets. I’ll

speaker: HOSTESS
text: drink no more than will do me good, for no man’s

speaker: HOSTESS
text: pleasure, I.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Then, to you, Mistress Dorothy! I will charge

speaker: PISTOL
text: you.

speaker: DOLL
text: Charge me? I scorn you, scurvy companion.

speaker: DOLL
text: What, you poor, base, rascally, cheating lack-linen

speaker: DOLL
text: mate! Away, you mouldy rogue, away! I am meat for

speaker: DOLL
text: your master.

speaker: PISTOL
text: I know you, Mistress Dorothy.

speaker: DOLL
text: Away, you cutpurse rascal, you filthy bung, away!

speaker: DOLL
text: By this wine, I’ll thrust my knife in your mouldy

speaker: DOLL
text: chaps an you play the saucy cuttle with me. Away,

speaker: DOLL
text: you bottle-ale rascal, you basket-hilt stale juggler,

speaker: DOLL
text: you. Since when, I pray you, sir? God’s light, with

speaker: DOLL
text: two points on your shoulder? Much!

speaker: PISTOL
text: God let me not live but I will murder your ruff

speaker: PISTOL
text: for this.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No more, Pistol. I would not have you go off

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: here. Discharge yourself of our company, Pistol.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: No, good Captain Pistol, not here, sweet

speaker: HOSTESS
text: captain!

speaker: DOLL
text: Captain? Thou abominable damned cheater, art

speaker: DOLL
text: thou not ashamed to be called captain? An captains

speaker: DOLL
text: were of my mind, they would truncheon you out for

speaker: DOLL
text: taking their names upon you before you have

speaker: DOLL
text: earned them. You a captain? You slave, for what?

speaker: DOLL
text: For tearing a poor whore’s ruff in a bawdy house?

speaker: DOLL
text: He a captain! Hang him, rogue. He lives upon

speaker: DOLL
text: mouldy stewed prunes and dried cakes. A captain?

speaker: DOLL
text: God’s light, these villains will make the word as

speaker: DOLL
text: odious as the word “occupy,” which was an excellent

speaker: DOLL
text: good word before it was ill sorted. Therefore

speaker: DOLL
text: captains had need look to ’t.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Pray thee go down, good ancient.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hark thee hither, Mistress Doll.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Not I. I tell thee what, Corporal

speaker: PISTOL
text: Bardolph, I could tear her. I’ll be revenged of her.

speaker: PAGE
text: Pray thee go down.

speaker: PISTOL
text: I’ll see her damned first to Pluto’s damnèd

speaker: PISTOL
text: lake, by this hand, to th’ infernal deep with Erebus

speaker: PISTOL
text: and tortures vile also. Hold hook and line, say I.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Down, down, dogs! Down, Fates! Have we not

speaker: PISTOL
text: Hiren here?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Good Captain Peesell, be quiet. ’Tis very late,

speaker: HOSTESS
text: i’ faith. I beseek you now, aggravate your choler.

speaker: PISTOL
text: These be good humors indeed. Shall pack-horses

speaker: PISTOL
text: and hollow pampered jades of Asia, which

speaker: PISTOL
text: cannot go but thirty mile a day, compare with

speaker: PISTOL
text: Caesars and with cannibals and Troyant Greeks?

speaker: PISTOL
text: Nay, rather damn them with King Cerberus, and let

speaker: PISTOL
text: the welkin roar. Shall we fall foul for toys?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: By my troth, captain, these are very bitter

speaker: HOSTESS
text: words.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Begone, good ancient. This will grow to a

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: brawl anon.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Die men like dogs! Give crowns like pins! Have

speaker: PISTOL
text: we not Hiren here?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O’ my word, captain, there’s none such here.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: What the good-year, do you think I would deny her?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: For God’s sake, be quiet.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Then feed and be fat, my fair Calipolis. Come,

speaker: PISTOL
text: give ’s some sack. Si fortune me tormente, sperato

speaker: PISTOL
text: me contento. Fear we broadsides? No, let the fiend

speaker: PISTOL
text: give fire. Give me some sack, and, sweetheart, lie

speaker: PISTOL
text:
thou there.

                down
                 
                his
                 
                sword

speaker: PISTOL
text: full points here? And are etceteras nothings?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Pistol, I would be quiet.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Sweet knight, I kiss thy neaf. What, we have

speaker: PISTOL
text: seen the seven stars.

speaker: DOLL
text: For God’s sake, thrust him downstairs. I cannot

speaker: DOLL
text: endure such a fustian rascal.

speaker: PISTOL
text: “Thrust him downstairs”? Know we not Galloway

speaker: PISTOL
text: nags?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Quoit him down, Bardolph, like a shove-groat

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: shilling. Nay, an he do nothing but speak

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: nothing, he shall be nothing here.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Come, get you downstairs.

speaker: PISTOL
text: What, shall we have

speaker: PISTOL
text: incision? Shall we imbrue? Then death rock me

speaker: PISTOL
text: asleep, abridge my doleful days. Why then, let

speaker: PISTOL
text: grievous, ghastly, gaping wounds untwind the Sisters

speaker: PISTOL
text: Three. Come, Atropos, I say.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Here’s goodly stuff toward!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Give me my rapier, boy.

speaker: DOLL
text: I pray thee, Jack, I pray thee do not draw.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Get you downstairs.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Here’s a goodly tumult. I’ll forswear keeping

speaker: HOSTESS
text: house afore I’ll be in these tirrits and frights. So,

speaker: HOSTESS
text: murder, I warrant now. Alas, alas, put up your

speaker: HOSTESS
text: naked weapons, put up your naked weapons.

speaker: DOLL
text: I pray thee, Jack, be quiet. The rascal’s gone. Ah,

speaker: DOLL
text: you whoreson little valiant villain, you.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Are you not hurt i’ th’ groin?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Methought he made a shrewd thrust at your belly.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Have you turned him out o’ doors?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Yea, sir. The rascal’s drunk. You have hurt

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: him, sir, i’ th’ shoulder.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A rascal to brave me!

speaker: DOLL
text: Ah, you sweet little rogue, you. Alas, poor ape,

speaker: DOLL
text: how thou sweat’st! Come, let me wipe thy face.

speaker: DOLL
text: Come on, you whoreson chops. Ah, rogue, i’ faith, I

speaker: DOLL
text: love thee. Thou art as valorous as Hector of Troy,

speaker: DOLL
text: worth five of Agamemnon, and ten times better

speaker: DOLL
text: than the Nine Worthies. Ah, villain!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Ah, rascally slave! I will toss the rogue in a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: blanket.

speaker: DOLL
text: Do, an thou darest for thy heart. An thou dost, I’ll

speaker: DOLL
text: canvass thee between a pair of sheets.

speaker: PAGE
text: The music is come, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Let them play.—Play, sirs.—Sit on my knee,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Doll. A rascal bragging slave! The rogue fled from

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me like quicksilver.

speaker: DOLL
text: I’ faith, and thou followed’st him like a church.

speaker: DOLL
text: Thou whoreson little tidy Bartholomew boar-pig,

speaker: DOLL
text: when wilt thou leave fighting a-days and foining a-nights

speaker: DOLL
text: and begin to patch up thine old body for

speaker: DOLL
text: heaven?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Peace, good Doll. Do not speak like a death’s-head;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: do not bid me remember mine end.

speaker: DOLL
text: Sirrah, what humor’s the Prince of?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A good shallow young fellow, he would have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: made a good pantler; he would ’a chipped bread

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: well.

speaker: DOLL
text: They say Poins has a good wit.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: He a good wit? Hang him, baboon. His wit’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: as thick as Tewkesbury mustard. There’s no more

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: conceit in him than is in a mallet.

speaker: DOLL
text: Why does the Prince love him so then?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Because their legs are both of a bigness, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: he plays at quoits well, and eats conger and fennel,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and drinks off candles’ ends for flap-dragons, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rides the wild mare with the boys, and jumps upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: joint stools, and swears with a good grace, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: wears his boots very smooth like unto the sign of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the Leg, and breeds no bate with telling of discreet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: stories, and such other gambol faculties he has that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: show a weak mind and an able body, for the which

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the Prince admits him; for the Prince himself is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: such another. The weight of a hair will turn the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: scales between their avoirdupois.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Would not this nave of a wheel

speaker: PRINCE
text: have his ears cut off?

speaker: POINS
text: Let’s beat him before his whore.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Look whe’er the withered elder hath not his

speaker: PRINCE
text: poll clawed like a parrot.

speaker: POINS
text: Is it not strange that desire should so many years

speaker: POINS
text: outlive performance?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Kiss me, Doll.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Saturn and Venus this year in

speaker: PRINCE
text: conjunction! What says th’ almanac to that?

speaker: POINS
text: And look whether the fiery trigon, his man, be

speaker: POINS
text: not lisping to his master’s old tables, his notebook,

speaker: POINS
text: his counsel keeper.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Thou dost give me flattering busses.

speaker: DOLL
text: By my troth, I kiss thee with a most constant

speaker: DOLL
text: heart.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I am old, I am old.

speaker: DOLL
text: I love thee better than I love e’er a scurvy young

speaker: DOLL
text: boy of them all.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What stuff wilt thou have a kirtle of? I shall

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: receive money o’ Thursday; thou shalt have a cap

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: tomorrow. A merry song! Come, it grows late. We’ll

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: to bed. Thou ’lt forget me when I am gone.

speaker: DOLL
text: By my troth, thou ’lt set me a-weeping an thou

speaker: DOLL
text: sayst so. Prove that ever I dress myself handsome till

speaker: DOLL
text: thy return. Well, harken a’ th’ end.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Some sack, Francis.

speaker:
PRINCE
              ,
               
              POINS
text: Anon, anon, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Ha? A bastard son of the King’s?—And art

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: not thou Poins his brother?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why, thou globe of sinful continents, what a

speaker: PRINCE
text: life dost thou lead?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A better than thou. I am a gentleman. Thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: art a drawer.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Very true, sir, and I come to draw you out by

speaker: PRINCE
text: the ears.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O, the Lord preserve thy good Grace! By my

speaker: HOSTESS
text: troth, welcome to London. Now the Lord bless that

speaker: HOSTESS
text: sweet face of thine. O Jesu, are you come from

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Wales?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Thou whoreson mad compound

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of majesty, by this light flesh and corrupt blood,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thou art welcome.

speaker: DOLL
text: How? You fat fool, I scorn you.

speaker: POINS
text: My lord, he will drive you out of your revenge

speaker: POINS
text: and turn all to a merriment if you take not the heat.

speaker: PRINCE
text: You whoreson candle-mine, you,

speaker: PRINCE
text: how vilely did you speak of me even now before

speaker: PRINCE
text: this honest, virtuous, civil gentlewoman!

speaker: HOSTESS
text: God’s blessing of your good heart, and so she

speaker: HOSTESS
text: is, by my troth.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Didst thou hear me?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Yea, and you knew me as you did when you ran

speaker: PRINCE
text: away by Gad’s Hill. You knew I was at your back,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and spoke it on purpose to try my patience.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No, no, no, not so. I did not think thou wast

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: within hearing.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I shall drive you, then, to confess the wilfull

speaker: PRINCE
text: abuse, and then I know how to handle you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No abuse, Hal, o’ mine honor, no abuse.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Not to dispraise me and call me pantler and

speaker: PRINCE
text: bread-chipper and I know not what?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No abuse, Hal.

speaker: POINS
text: No abuse?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No abuse, Ned, i’ th’ world, honest Ned,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: none. I dispraised him before the wicked,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: that the wicked might not fall in love with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thee; in which doing, I have done the part of a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: careful friend and a true subject, and thy father is to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: give me thanks for it. No abuse, Hal.—None, Ned,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: none. No, faith, boys, none.

speaker: PRINCE
text: See now whether pure fear and entire cowardice

speaker: PRINCE
text: doth not make thee wrong this virtuous gentlewoman

speaker: PRINCE
text: to close with us. Is she of the wicked, is

speaker: PRINCE
text: thine hostess here of the wicked, or is thy boy of the

speaker: PRINCE
text: wicked, or honest Bardolph, whose zeal burns in

speaker: PRINCE
text: his nose, of the wicked?

speaker: POINS
text: Answer, thou dead elm, answer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: The fiend hath pricked down Bardolph irrecoverable,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and his face is Lucifer’s privy kitchen,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: where he doth nothing but roast malt-worms. For

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the boy, there is a good angel about him, but the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: devil blinds him too.

speaker: PRINCE
text: For the women?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: For one of them, she’s in hell already and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: burns poor souls. For th’ other, I owe her money,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and whether she be damned for that I know not.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: No, I warrant you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No, I think thou art not. I think thou art quit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: for that. Marry, there is another indictment upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thee for suffering flesh to be eaten in thy house

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: contrary to the law, for the which I think thou wilt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: howl.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: All vitlars do so. What’s a joint of mutton or

speaker: HOSTESS
text: two in a whole Lent?

speaker: PRINCE
text: You, gentlewoman.

speaker: DOLL
text: What says your Grace?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: His grace says that which his flesh rebels

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: against.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Who knocks so loud at door? Look to th’ door

speaker: HOSTESS
text: there, Francis.

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Peto
              ,
               
              how
               
              now
              ,
               
              what
               
              news
              ?

speaker: PETO
text:
The
               
              King
               
              your
               
              father
               
              is
               
              at
               
              Westminster
              ,

speaker: PETO
text:
And
               
              there
               
              are
               
              twenty
               
              weak
               
              and
               
              wearied
               
              posts

speaker: PETO
text:
Come
               
              from
               
              the
               
              north
              ,
               
              and
               
              as
               
              I
               
              came
               
              along

speaker: PETO
text:
I
               
              met
               
              and
               
              overtook
               
              a
               
              dozen
               
              captains
              ,

speaker: PETO
text:
Bareheaded
              ,
               
              sweating
              ,
               
              knocking
               
              at
               
              the
               
              taverns

speaker: PETO
text:
And
               
              asking
               
              everyone
               
              for
               
              Sir
               
              John
               
              Falstaff
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
By
               
              heaven
              ,
               
              Poins
              ,
               
              I
               
              feel
               
              me
               
              much
               
              to
               
              blame

speaker: PRINCE
text:
So
               
              idly
               
              to
               
              profane
               
              the
               
              precious
               
              time

speaker: PRINCE
text:
When
               
              tempest
               
              of
               
              commotion
              ,
               
              like
               
              the
               
              south

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Borne
               
              with
               
              black
               
              vapor
              ,
               
              doth
               
              begin
               
              to
               
              melt

speaker: PRINCE
text:
And
               
              drop
               
              upon
               
              our
               
              bare
               
              unarmèd
               
              heads
              .
              —

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Give
               
              me
               
              my
               
              sword
               
              and
               
              cloak
              .
              —
              Falstaff
              ,
               
              good
               
              night
              .

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Now comes in the sweetest morsel of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: night, and we must hence and leave it unpicked.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
(
                
                  Knocking
                  .
                
                 
                
                  Bardolph
                   
                  exits
                  .
                
                )
               More knocking at the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
door? 
                (
                Bardolph
                 
                returns
                .
                )
               How now, what’s the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: matter?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text:
You
               
              must
               
              away
               
              to
               
              court
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              presently
              .

speaker: BARDOLPH
text:
A
               
              dozen
               
              captains
               
              stay
               
              at
               
              door
               
              for
               
              you
              .

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Pay the musicians, sirrah.—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Farewell, hostess.—Farewell, Doll. You see, my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: good wenches, how men of merit are sought after.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: The undeserver may sleep when the man of action

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: is called on. Farewell, good wenches. If I be not sent

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: away post, I will see you again ere I go.

speaker: DOLL
text: I cannot speak. If my heart be not ready to

speaker: DOLL
text: burst—well, sweet Jack, have a care of thyself.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Farewell, farewell.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Well, fare thee well. I have known thee these

speaker: HOSTESS
text: twenty-nine years, come peasecod time, but an

speaker: HOSTESS
text: honester and truer-hearted man—well, fare thee

speaker: HOSTESS
text: well.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Mistress Tearsheet!

speaker: HOSTESS
text: What’s the matter?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Bid Mistress Tearsheet come to my

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: master.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O, run, Doll, run, run, good Doll. Come.—

speaker: HOSTESS
text: She comes blubbered.—Yea! Will you come, Doll?
